title: Reveal a ggplot incrementally
text: goal ggreveal make easy present data ggplot graphs incrementally. want ? ’s fun, often useful teaching academic presentations. can reveal data group: panel: layer: See explanation functions needed.

title: Reveal a ggplot incrementally
text: Create ggplot usually .  use one reveal_panels(), reveal_groups() reveal_layers() obtain list plots show elements incrementally.    can save graphs using reveal_save(), can, e.g., include later slides:
code: library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2)  p <-  ggplot(penguins[!is.na(penguins$sex),],              aes(body_mass_g, bill_length_mm,                  group=sex, color=sex)) +       geom_point() +       geom_smooth(method="lm", formula = 'y ~ x', linewidth=1) +       facet_wrap(~species) +       theme_minimal() p library(ggreveal) plot_list <- reveal_groups(p) plot_list #> [[1]] #>  #> [[2]] #>  #> [[3]] reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot", width = 8, height = 4)

what: Wait, can’t ggplot2 do this already?
title: Reveal a ggplot incrementally
text: Yes . ggplot composable design, straightforward things package manually, especially reveal layer. example, can create graph steps save steps separately: problem : add layers elements, several visual aspects graph — e.g. range axes, legends — can (often) change. easily solvable (e.g. set limits fix axis range), . Showing changes graph layout add elements useful teaching make graphs ggplot2 (see package flipbookr, makes even easier), distracting want focus results presented plot.
code: data("mtcars") p1 <- ggplot(mtcars,              aes(mpg, wt)) +      geom_point()        p2 <- p1 + geom_smooth()

title: Reveal plot by group — reveal_groups
text: Creates list plots, showing data incrementally groups.

title: Reveal plot by group — reveal_groups
text: p ggplot2 object, group aesthetic used. order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal groups.

title: Reveal plot by group — reveal_groups
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by group — reveal_groups
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +   facet_wrap(~am) p   plot_list <- reveal_groups(p) plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot", width = 8, height = 4) }

title: Reveal plot by layer — reveal_layers
text: Creates list plots, showing data incrementally layers.

title: Reveal plot by layer — reveal_layers
text: p ggplot2 object, group aesthetic used. order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal layers.

title: Reveal plot by layer — reveal_layers
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by layer — reveal_layers
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +   facet_wrap(~am) p   plot_list <- reveal_layers(p) plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot", width = 8, height = 4) }

title: Reveal plot by facet — reveal_panels
text: Creates list plots, showing data incrementally layers.

title: Reveal plot by facet — reveal_panels
text: p ggplot2 object, group aesthetic used. order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal panels. (optional) one "data" "everything".' "data", basic graph layout (including axes facet labels) shown start, data points shown incrementally. "everything", entire panels shown incrementally.

title: Reveal plot by facet — reveal_panels
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by facet — reveal_panels
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +   facet_wrap(~am) p   # Only data plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "data") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   # Everything plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "everything") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot", width = 8, height = 4) }

title: Saves incremental plots — reveal_save
text: plot_list list plots created reveal_groups(), reveal_layers() reveal_panels() basename base file name used saving ... Additional arguments (e.g. width, height) passed ggplot2::ggsave()

title: Saves incremental plots — reveal_save
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +   facet_wrap(~am) p   plot_list <- reveal_groups(p) plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot", width = 8, height = 4) }
